meanings.definition: To expose to the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: The picnic blanket will insolate in the warm sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She likes to insolate her plants on the windowsill.
meanings.sent3: Let's insolate the cookies on the porch for a natural bake.
meanings.sent4: The desert sand insolates quickly under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The solar panels insolate all day to generate electricity.

meanings.definition: To dry or harden in the sun.
meanings.sent1: The wet laundry will insolate on the clothesline.
meanings.sent2: The clay figurine needs to insolate before painting.
meanings.sent3: He forgot to insolate the glue, so the project got messy.
meanings.sent4: The paint will insolate smoothly under the warm sun.
meanings.sent5: The fresh paint insolates to a glossy finish in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To heat or become heated by the sun.
meanings.sent1: The black car will insolate quickly in the summer heat.
meanings.sent2: The metal bench insolates and becomes too hot to sit on.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to insolate on the windowsill for warmth.
meanings.sent4: The rocks insolate and radiate heat in the afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The pavement insolates and creates a mirage in the distance.
